New Records: Devon Conway scored 152 off 121 balls, his highest score in ODIs.
Rachin Ravindra scored 123 off 96 balls, his highest score in ODIs.
Key Match Events: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra hit centuries in New Zealand's victory.
Rachin Ravindra took the knife on whose edge the game was briefly balanced, and started slashing.
Harry Brook was the only England batter to demonstrate fluency and attacking intent, but he could only maintain it for three balls.
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand will treasure their victory, particularly Devon Conway's century.
England's cricket fans will be left with grisly memories of their defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw a high-scoring chase, with New Zealand reaching their target with 82 balls to spare.
The game saw the debut of several new records, including Conway and Ravindra's centuries.
The absence of Lockie Ferguson and Tim Southee did not hinder New Zealand's bowling performance.
Others: The article mentions that the match was played at the Narendra Modi Stadium, and that the weather conditions were hot in the afternoon.
